name: Python in 45 Minutes
tagline: Teaching Python in 45 minutes? Challenge Accepted.
body:
### So today, you're learning Python.
![](http://static3.businessinsider.com/image/5238c9c5ecad047f12b2751a/internet-famous-grumpy-cat-just-landed-an-endorsement-deal-with-friskies.jpg)

Yeah. Not fun, right? Let's jump right in, and we'll see if you enjoy it!

```
print("Welcome to Python 3!")
```

Welcome, young cadets, to Python 3. A planet with a slightly toxic, but organic-supporting atmosphere.

![](http://img1.wikia.nocookie.net/__cb20100113135842/starwars/images/4/4e/PurplePlanet-FT.jpg)

Please keep your masks on at all times.
![](http://img.photobucket.com/albums/v625/lostncybr/Avatar/8ac4e8fc.jpg)

### Designer Templates
We've crafted some handsome templates for you to use. Go ahead and continue to layouts to browse through them. You can easily go back to edit your page before publishing. After publishing your page, you can revisit the page generator and switch to another theme. Your Page content will be preserved if it remained markdown format.

### Rather Drive Stick?
If you prefer to not use the automatic generator, push a branch named `gh-pages` to your repository to create a page manually. In addition to supporting regular HTML content, GitHub Pages support Jekyll, a simple, blog aware static site generator written by our own Tom Preston-Werner. Jekyll makes it easy to create site-wide headers and footers without having to copy them across every page. It also offers intelligent blog support and other advanced templating features.

### Authors and Contributors
@0xdragon is the author of this document which was used for teaching a 2014 class Python in only 45 minutes.
note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
